Bertemu Edhy Prabowo, Dubes Jepang Bantu KKP 2,5 Miliar Yen
01 Nov 2019, 05:12 by Antara, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Pemerintah Jepang telah memberikan bantuan untuk kawasan-kawasan terluar Indonesia senilai 2,5 miliar yen. Menteri Kelautan dan Perikanan Edhy Prabowo mengapresiasi bantuan yang diberikan Jepang untuk pembangunan sentra kelautan dan perikanan terpadu di pulau-pulau terdepan wilayah Indonesia itu.
"Bantuan akan digunakan untuk membangun dan memperkuat SKPT yang berfungsi sebagai wadah berkumpulnya nelayan-nelayan di wilayah terdepan Republik Indonesia," kata Edhy Prabowo dalam siaran pers, Jumat 1 November 2019.
Sebelumnya, Menteri Edhy telah menerima kunjungan Duta Besar Jepang untuk Republik Indonesia Masafumi Ishii di kantor Kementerian Kelautan dan Perikanan (KKP) pada Kamis 31 Oktober 2019. Dalam pertemuan tersebut, kedua belah pihak berdiskusi mengenai kelanjutan kerja sama antara Indonesia dan Jepang di bidang kelautan dan perikanan ke depannya.
Edhy Prabowo mengatakan, Jepang berniat melanjutkan bantuan untuk membangun dan memperkuat beberapa SKPT. Jepang bahkan menambah bantuan berupa satu unit radar pantai dan satu kapal pengawas yang akan segera direalisasikan pada 2019 ini.
Terkait bantuan radar pantai dan hibah kapal pengawas ini, Sekretaris Jenderal KKP Nilanto Perbowo menginginkan bantuan itu memenuhi standar Jepang, sehingga dapat memperkuat pengawasan di perairan Indonesia secara optimal.
Sementara itu, Masafumi Ishii mengatakan Indonesia dan Jepang merupakan negara kepulauan yang memiliki strategi yang sejalan dalam pengelolaannya, termasuk dalam pengembangan sektor kelautan dan perikanan melalui beberapa proyek yang digarap bersama.
Sebelumnya, KKP juga menjalin kerja sama bidang pengembangan kapasitas kemaritiman dengan Institut Studi Kemaritiman Maroko. Kerja sama itu untuk menindaklanjuti nota kesepahaman yang telah ditandatangani kedua negara.

Meeting with Edhy Prabowo, Japanese Ambassador Helps 2.5 Billion Yen KKP
Nov 1, 2019, 05:12 by Antara, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Japanese government has provided assistance to Indonesia's outer regions worth 2.5 billion yen. Minister of Maritime Affairs and Fisheries Edhy Prabowo appreciated the assistance provided by Japan for the development of integrated marine and fisheries centers in the foremost islands of Indonesia.
"The assistance will be used to build and strengthen the SKPT which functions as a gathering place for fishermen in the forefront of the Republic of Indonesia," Edhy Prabowo said in a press release, Friday, November 1, 2019.
Earlier, Minister Edhy had received a visit from the Japanese Ambassador to the Republic of Indonesia Masafumi Ishii at the Office of the Ministry of Maritime Affairs and Fisheries (KKP) on Thursday 31 October 2019. During the meeting, the two sides discussed the continuation of cooperation between Indonesia and Japan in the field of maritime affairs and fisheries going forward.
Edhy Prabowo said, Japan intends to continue assistance to build and strengthen several SKPT. Japan even added assistance in the form of a coastal radar unit and a surveillance ship which will soon be realized in 2019.
Regarding the coast radar assistance and the supervision ship's grant, KKP Secretary General Nilanto Perbowo wants the assistance to meet Japanese standards, so that it can strengthen supervision in Indonesian waters optimally.
Meanwhile, Masafumi Ishii said that Indonesia and Japan are archipelagic countries that have a consistent strategy in their management, including in the development of the marine and fisheries sector through several projects which are jointly worked on.
Previously, the CTF also collaborated in the field of maritime capacity development with the Moroccan Institute of Maritime Studies. The cooperation was to follow up on the memorandum of understanding that had been signed by the two countries.
